title: Strong Rule of Law Framework
description: In 2023, Ghana had 16 sources contributing to its Rule of Law assessment, indicating a robust legal framework and adherence to legal principles.

title: Efficient Labor Regulations
description: Ghana scored 91.08 in 2024 for the operational efficiency of labor regulations, showcasing a conducive environment for workforce management.

title: High Benefit Incidence for Poorest Quintile
description: In 2016, 57.56% of social safety net benefits in Ghana were directed to the poorest quintile, reflecting a strong focus on social equity.

title: Quality Regulations for Business Location
description: Ghana achieved a score of 87.58 in 2024 for the quality of regulations concerning business locations, highlighting a favorable business environment.

title: Effective Government Operations
description: In 2023, Ghana's government effectiveness was evaluated using 13 sources, indicating a well-functioning public sector.

title: Low Standard Error in Rule of Law
description: With a standard error of 0.139 in 2023, Ghana's Rule of Law assessments are consistent, reflecting reliability in legal evaluations.

title: High Control of Corruption
description: In 2023, 15 sources were used to assess Ghana's control of corruption, indicating a strong stance against corrupt practices.

title: Low Business Entry Score
description: Ghana's overall score for business entry was 40.98 in 2024, suggesting challenges in starting new businesses.

title: Negative Other Taxes Contribution
description: In 2022, other taxes contributed negatively to Ghana's revenue, with a value of -4.26% of total revenue, indicating fiscal challenges.

title: Negative Other Taxes in Local Currency
description: Ghana's other taxes in 2022 amounted to -4.11 billion in local currency, reflecting a significant fiscal deficit.
